question_text: A 19-year-old woman is evaluated for a facial rash and arthralgia involving the small joints of her hands.Skin findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for the skin findings?
critique: The most likely diagnosis for the skin findings shown is acute cutaneous lupus erythematosus (ACLE) (Option A), which is typically precipitated by sunlight. ACLE can present as the classic butterfly rash, which is characterized by confluent malar erythema with sparing of the nasolabial folds, as seen here. ACLE can also present as generalized, red, papular, or urticarial lesions on sun-exposed skin. ACLE is found almost exclusively in patients with symptomatic systemic lupus erythematosus and positive results on serologic testing.
